SEARCH
Package be.kdg.memorace.model

Class Memorace

java.lang.Object
be.kdg.memorace.model.Memorace
public class Memorace extends Object
This class represents the game logic of Memorace. It keeps track of the game state, such as the players, pawns, cards, turn, timer, etc. It also provides various methods to manipulate the game state, such as adding cards to a player's hand, checking if two cards match, calculating the winner, etc.
Since:
08/12/2022
Author:
Vera Wise, Elias De Hondt

  • Constructor Details

    • Memorace

      public Memorace()
      Initializes a new instance of the Memorace class. Initializes the turn with 0. Creates a new player list, a new die, a new pawn list, and a new card map. Sets the default background and button volume to 50% and 100%, respectively. Creates a new music handler and plays the game music with the default button volume. Creates a new timer.

  • Method Details

    • turn

      public Player turn()
      Returns the current player whose turn it is. If the current turn is greater than or equal to the number of players, sets the turn back to the first player.
      Returns:
      The current player whose turn it is.

    • dontTurn

      public Player dontTurn()
      Doesn't change the turn and just returns the player who was taking their turn before.
      Returns:
      The player who was taking their turn before.

    • currentPlayer

      public int currentPlayer(Player player)
      Returns the index of the given player in the list of players.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to find the index of.
      Returns:
      The index of the given player in the list of players.

    • compare2Cards

      public boolean compare2Cards(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView1, javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView2)
      Compares two cards represented by the given ImageViews.
      Parameters:
      imageView1 - The first ImageView representing a card.
      imageView2 - The second ImageView representing a card.
      Returns:
      True if the cards match, false otherwise.

    • addCardToPlayer

      public void addCardToPlayer(int playerID, javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView)
      Adds a card represented by the specified ImageView to the player with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player to add the card to
      imageView - the ImageView representing the card to be added

    • winner

      public Player winner()
      This method returns the player with the highest score among all the players.
      Returns:
      The player with the highest score among all the players, so the winner of the game.

    • getValidCardsIDs

      public List<Integer> getValidCardsIDs(int i)
      This method generates a list of valid card IDs based on the position on the game board.
      Parameters:
      i - The position on the game board
      Returns:
      List of valid card IDs
